0.title: Introduction
0.content: Introduction Introducing Montreal, a mini CSS library allowing you to quickly and easily create stylish news cards. Packed with a host of styling classes and custom properties, Montreal allows you extended control in crafting stylish news cards for your website. Simply load the CSS library into your project, add the element markup combined with the style classes of your choice to custom build your perfect news card. Features 4 alternative layouts 4 alternative hover styles 8 definable custom properties Animated hover effect Fully responsive across all devices Easily customized to your own perfect taste

2.title: Getting Started
2.content: Getting Started Extract and copy the CSS files in the root of your download folder to your projects CSS folder. Include a link to the CSS your document’s <head> tags. We would suggest making this link the last of the CSS files linked. <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/montreal.min.css"> Use the following markup to create the most basic instance of an image hover element.. <div class="c4-montreal c4-shadow" style="max-width: 380px;"> <div class="c4-montreal-image"> <div class="c4-montreal-hover-icon"> <svg aria-hidden="true" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 448 512"><path d="M416 208H272V64c0-17.67-14.33-32-32-32h-32c-17.67 0-32 14.33-32 32v144H32c-17.67 0-32 14.33-32 32v32c0 17.67 14.33 32 32 32h144v144c0 17.67 14.33 32 32 32h32c17.67 0 32-14.33 32-32V304h144c17.67 0 32-14.33 32-32v-32c0-17.67-14.33-32-32-32z"></path></svg> </div> <img src="https://source.unsplash.com/FaPxZ88yZrw/400x300" alt="Sample Image"> </div> <div class="c4-montreal-content"> <h3>Sample Title</h3> <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. 6.title: Custom Properties
6.content: Defining Custom Properties Key variables of the CSS library can be set using https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/–* either globally or inline within a single or selected number of elements. Defining custom properties globally The following example shows how custom properties can be defined globally across your project. Ensure that such CSS is loaded after the library CSS. .c4-montreal { --primary-color: #F6CD14; --secondary-color: #D0206E; } Defining custom properties inline This example shows how custom properties can be defined inline within a single element. These can be defined inline within the <figure or to a containing div if you wish to define properties to a group elements. <div class="c4-montreal c4-montreal-layout-column c4-shadow" style=" --primary-color: #71B280; --secondary-color: #134E5E; --text-color: #fff; --bg-color: #111; --bg-color-footer: #444; "> <div class="c4-montreal-image"> <div class="c4-montreal-date"> <div class="c4-montreal-date-top"> 10 </div> <div class="c4-montreal-date-bottom"> Jan </div> </div> <div class="c4-montreal-hover-icon"> <svg aria-hidden="true" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 448 512"><path d="M416 208H272V64c0-17.67-14.33-32-32-32h-32c-17.67 0-32 14.33-32 32v144H32c-17.67 0-32 14.33-32 32v32c0 17.67 14.33 32 32 32h144v144c0 17.67 14.33 32 32 32h32c17.67 0 32-14.33 32-32V304h144c17.67 0 32-14.33 32-32v-32c0-17.67-14.33-32-32-32z"></path></svg> </div> <img src="assets/images/image06.jpg" alt="Sample Image"> </div> <div class="c4-montreal-content"> <h2>Sample News Title</h2> <h3 class="c4-color-primary">Cras ornare tristique elit</h3> <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. 7.title: Utility Classes
7.content: Utility Classes This library includes some simply utility classes. These classes allow you to apply simple CSS properties on individual elements. <h3 class="c4-text-align-center">Sample Title</h3> c4-text-align-left Type: text-align Align text element to the left. c4-text-align-center Type: text-align Align text element to center. c4-text-align-right Type: text-align Align text element to the left. c4-color-primary Type: color Apply primary color to element. c4-color-secondary Type: color Apply secondary color to element. c4-shadow Type: box-shadow Apply box-shadow to element. c4-inline-svg Sizes an SVG inline with surrounding elements. c4-ml-auto Type: margin-left Set margin-left of element to auto. Usefull for pushing element to the right inside a flex container (eg footer). c4-mr-auto Type: margin-right Set margin-right of element to auto. Usefull for pushing element to the left inside a flex container (eg footer).
